meanings.definition: A form of government in which power is held by property owners.
meanings.sent1: In a timocracy, those who own land have the most say in how things are run.
meanings.sent2: The timocracy allowed only landowners to participate in decision-making.
meanings.sent3: The timocracy meeting turned into a debate about who had the biggest farm.
meanings.sent4: The timocracy resembled a kingdom ruled by those with the most acres.
meanings.sent5: Living in a timocracy meant your voice depended on your property size.

meanings.definition: A society or state governed by property owners.
meanings.sent1: The timocracy prospered under the leadership of wealthy landowners.
meanings.sent2: In the timocracy, the elite class controlled all aspects of life.
meanings.sent3: The timocracy picnic was filled with discussions on land values.
meanings.sent4: The timocracy stood tall like a castle built on riches.
meanings.sent5: Being part of a timocracy meant following the rules set by the property holders.

meanings.definition: A political system in which wealth determines political power.
meanings.sent1: The timocracy favored those with money when making important decisions.
meanings.sent2: In a timocracy, the size of your wallet determined your influence.
meanings.sent3: The timocracy election was like a bidding war for control.
meanings.sent4: Money spoke the loudest in the timocracy's halls of power.
meanings.sent5: Participating in the timocracy meant understanding the value of wealth in politics.
